item.title: Insyde Software Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)
item.description: Insyde Software Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)newsApril 29, 2025Insyde Softwareis now aCVE Numbering Authority (CNA)for vulnerabilities in all of Insyde Software’s firmware and software products, as well as vulnerabilities discovered by Insyde Software that are not covered by another CNA’s scope.

item.title: Vulnerability Data Enrichment for CVE Records: 251 CNAs on the Enrichment Recognition List for May 5, 2025
item.description: Vulnerability Data Enrichment for CVE Records: 251 CNAs on the Enrichment Recognition List for May 5, 2025blogBy CVE Program|May 6, 2025

item.title: Erlang Ecosystem Foundation Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)
item.description: Erlang Ecosystem Foundation Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)newsMay 13, 2025Erlang Ecosystem Foundationis now aCVE Numbering Authority (CNA)for vulnerabilities in active packages hosted onHex.pm, and in active projects hosted under the GitHub organizations@elixir-lang,@erlang,@erlef-cna,@erlef,@gleam-lang, and@hexpm, unless covered by the scope of another CNA.

item.title: SCHUTZWERK Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)
item.description: SCHUTZWERK Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)newsMay 13, 2025SCHUTZWERK GmbHis now aCVE Numbering Authority (CNA)for vulnerabilities discovered by, reported to, or coordinated by, SCHUTZWERK unless covered by another CNA.

item.title: Stackable Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)
item.description: Stackable Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)newsMay 13, 2025Stackable GmbHis now aCVE Numbering Authority (CNA)for vulnerabilities in Stackable products including end-of-life or unsupported Stackable software, as well as open source projects that are not in another CNA’s scope.

item.title: CNA Operational Rules Updated to Version 4.1.0
item.description: CNA Operational Rules Updated to Version 4.1.0newsMay 13, 2025“CNA Operational Rules Version 4.1.0” was approved by theCVE Boardon May 14, 2025, and is effective as of May 14, 2025.CNA Rules v4.1.0, which has no breaking changes and was updated to improve the clarity of requirements throughout the document, is available now as aPDF(0.2MB).

item.title: Minutes from CVE Board Teleconference Meeting on April 16 Now Available
item.description: Minutes from CVE Board Teleconference Meeting on April 16 Now AvailablenewsMay 20, 2025TheCVE Boardheld a teleconference meeting on April 16, 2025. Read themeeting minutes summary.

item.title: Minutes from CVE Board Teleconference Meeting on April 30 Now Available
item.description: Minutes from CVE Board Teleconference Meeting on April 30 Now AvailablenewsMay 20, 2025TheCVE Boardheld a teleconference meeting on April 30, 2025. Read themeeting minutes summary.

item.title: Extreme Networks, Inc. Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)
item.description: Extreme Networks, Inc. Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)newsMay 20, 2025Extreme Networks, Inc.is now aCVE Numbering Authority (CNA)for vulnerabilities discovered in Extreme Networks, Inc.’s products and services.

item.title: “CNA Rules v4.1.0” Now in Effect
item.description: “CNA Rules v4.1.0” Now in EffectblogBy CVE Program|May 20, 2025TheCVE Numbering Authority (CNA) Operational Rules Version 4.1.0took effect on May 14, 2025. The previous version,CNA Rules v4.0, has been deprecated. CNAs are now required to comply with theCNA Rules v4.1.0.
